RESTful API endpoints for programmatic API key management including create, read, update, delete operations with proper authentication and authorization.

## Rationale
Enables automation, integration with existing tools, and programmatic key management. Critical for DevOps workflows and CI/CD pipelines. Addresses gap where users must manually edit files.

## User Stories
- As a DevOps engineer, I want to automate API key provisioning through scripts so that I can integrate with our user onboarding system
- As a developer, I want to programmatically manage test API keys so that I can automate test environment setup
- As an integrator, I want to call an API to manage keys so that I can build custom tooling on top of GLM Proxy

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] POST /admin/api/keys - Create new API key with validation
- [ ] GET /admin/api/keys - List all API keys with pagination
- [ ] GET /admin/api/keys/:id - Get specific API key details
- [ ] PUT /admin/api/keys/:id - Update API key properties
- [ ] DELETE /admin/api/keys/:id - Delete API key
- [ ] Admin API requires master API key or separate admin token
- [ ] API returns proper HTTP status codes and error messages
- [ ] Operations are atomic and prevent race conditions

## ‚úÖ Implementation Plan Created

I've successfully read the spec and created a comprehensive implementation plan for the **Admin API for CRUD Operations**.

### üìã Plan Overview

**8 Phases with 37 Subtasks:**

1. **Project Setup & Environment** (4 tasks)
   - Initialize project with Bun and TypeScript
   - Setup directory structure and dependencies

2. **Database Schema & Models** (4 tasks)
   - Design API keys table with SQLite
   - Create ApiKey model with CRUD operations

3. **Authentication & Authorization** (4 tasks)
   - Admin authentication middleware
   - Token generation and validation

4. **CRUD API Endpoints** (7 tasks)
   - POST /admin/api/keys - Create
   - GET /admin/api/keys - List (with pagination)
   - GET /admin/api/keys/:id - Retrieve
   - PUT /admin/api/keys/:id - Update
   - DELETE /admin/api/keys/:id - Delete

5. **Error Handling & Response Formatting** (5 tasks)
   - Standardized error responses
   - Request logging

6. **Testing** (9 tasks)
   - Unit tests for models and middleware
   - Integration tests for all endpoints
   - Authentication and concurrency tests

7. **Documentation** (4 tasks)
   - API documentation and usage examples
   - Setup and deployment guide

8. **Security Hardening** (4 tasks)
   - Secure API key storage with hashing
   - Rate limiting and CORS

### üìÅ Files Updated

- `implementation_plan.json` - Detailed plan with all phases and subtasks
- `build-progress.txt` - Progress tracking and notes

### üöÄ Ready for Implementation

The plan addresses all acceptance criteria from the spec:
- ‚úÖ All 5 CRUD endpoints
- ‚úÖ Admin authentication
- ‚úÖ Proper HTTP status codes
- ‚úÖ Atomic operations with race condition prevention

Ready to start implementation with **Phase 1: Project Setup & Environment**!

     3‚Üí  "description": "# Admin API for CRUD Operations\n\nRESTful API endpoints for programmatic API key management including create, read, update, delete operations with proper authentication and authorization.\n\n## Rationale\nEnables automation, integration with existing tools, and programmatic key management. Critical for DevOps workflows and CI/CD pipelines. Addresses gap where users must manually edit files.\n\n## User Stories\n- As a DevOps engineer, I want to automate API key provisioning through scripts so that I can integrate with our user onboarding system\n- As a developer, I want to programmatically manage test API keys so that I can automate test environment setup\n- As an integrator, I want to call an API to manage keys so that I can build custom tooling on top of GLM Proxy\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n- [ ] POST /admin/api/keys - Create new API key with validation\n- [ ] GET /admin/api/keys - List all API keys with pagination\n- [ ] GET /admin/api/keys/:id - Get specific API key details\n- [ ] PUT /admin/api/keys/:id - Update API key properties\n- [ ] DELETE /admin/api/keys/:id - Delete API key\n- [ ] Admin API requires master API key or separate admin token\n- [ ] API returns proper HTTP status codes and error messages\n- [ ] Operations are atomic and prevent race conditions\n",
